label.intro:
There are different approaches to field notes; which approach you take depends on your research questions and objectives.

Do you need thick description or rapid notes? Focused on one aspect (e.g. a plant), or on the whole system around that plant? Often, you will want to take several types of field notes as you will be looking to capture different aspects at different times.

Good field notes include not only precise observations and outcomes, but also personal reflection about these observations.
